title: Spiritual Care Department
description: Learn more about Cedars-Sinai's Spiritual Care Services, offered to patients, their friends and families, regardless of faith.
cleaned_text: The chaplains at Cedars-Sinai represent a wide array of religious, spiritual and cultural backgrounds. As a key part of your interdisciplinary healthcare team, they spend time with patients and their loved ones to provide spiritual support for people of all religions—or no religion—with compassion and understanding during your hospital stay. Spiritual Care Services Part of healing is addressing your spiritual or religious needs. Chaplains also provide support to all who are experiencing grief and emotional/spiritual distress. When you work with a Cedars-Sinai chaplain, they become an integral part of your healthcare team and will work to ensure that you are cared for holistically. Our Chapel is Open to All Our chapel is open 24 hours a day to people of all beliefs and backgrounds. The chapel is centrally located on the Plaza Level, between the North and South towers at the medical center. Chapel Services Schedule Monday Catholic Mass: 12-12:30 p.m. Reiki for Relaxation: 1-1:30 p.m. Tuesday Torah Study: 12-1 p.m. Catholic Mass: 12-12:30 p.m. Worship and Fellowship: 1-1:30 p.m. Thursday Mindfulness Meditation: 12-12:30 p.m. Friday Catholic Mass: 12-12:30 p.m. Muslim Prayer Service: 1:15-1:45 p.m. Sabbath on Go Service: 3-3:15 p.m. Shabbat Services (periodic): 9:30-11:30 a.m. Sunday Catholic Mass: 1:30-2 p.m. Clinical Pastoral Education Cedars-Sinai's clinical pastoral education program provides rigorous training and patient interaction. The program is accredited by the ACPE and combines hands-on clinical practice and spiritual reflection with structured teaching sessions and mentoring. Have Questions or Need Help? Call the Spiritual Care team Monday through Friday, 8 am - 5 pm PT, or [send a message](/patients-visitors/spiritual-care/request-a-chaplain.html). You can also visit our offices, which are on the Plaza Level, between the North and South towers, next to the chapel.
